entity_name: Clerk of the House of Representatives, All Staff Employees
summary: The documents provided primarily consist of payroll records for staff employees of the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). These records detail the employment history, salary adjustments, and position changes of various individuals working for the HSCA from 1976 to 1979. The documents include payroll authorization forms, memoranda related to payroll certifications, and requests for staff to disclose relationships to members of Congress. The Clerk of the House of Representatives is implicitly involved as the office responsible for processing and maintaining these payroll records for Congressional staff.
significance: The significance of the Clerk of the House of Representatives and HSCA staff employees in the JFK assassination context lies in their involvement in the investigation conducted by the HSCA. The payroll records provide insight into the staffing and financial operations of the committee, indirectly shedding light on the resources allocated to the investigation and the individuals involved in gathering information and formulating conclusions about the assassination.
